name: Introduction to Permaculture
description: Foundational concepts, ethics (Earth Care, People Care, Fair Share), observation skills, and the permaculture design process.

name: Zone Education
description: Understanding permaculture zones 0-5, placement logic based on frequency of access, and designing efficient energy flows.

name: Native First Approach
description: Bioregional plant selection, ecosystem services of native species, ethics of native vs. non-native plants, and supporting local biodiversity.

name: Polyculture Design
description: Building plant guilds, companion planting strategies, vertical layer stacking from canopy to root zone, and succession planting.

name: Systems Thinking
description: Observing patterns in nature, understanding feedback loops, whole-system design approaches, and leveraging edge effects.

name: Water Management
description: Swale and berm construction, pond design, keyline systems, rainwater harvesting, and working with water in the landscape.

name: Soil Building
description: Composting systems, mulching strategies, cover crops, no-till methods, and building healthy living soil ecosystems.

name: Urban Permaculture
description: Container guilds, vertical gardens, micro-climate creation, balcony and rooftop production, and intensive small-space design.

name: Food Forests
description: Seven-layer forest gardens, succession planning from pioneers to climax species, perennial systems, and designing productive woodland ecosystems.

name: Economics & Ethics
description: Fair trade principles, people care in practice, fair share and surplus distribution, community economics, and farm financial sustainability.
